column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Where did they come from ?
#Text=Mostly Mexico .
#Text=The vast majority came from Mexico and last time I looked 27 % of the federal penitentiary population are criminal aliens .
#Text=So there is a large criminal contingent that moves back and forth across the border , and we pay $ 3 billion a year to incarcerate those folks .
#Text=One year ’s incarceration costs would build a thousand miles of border fence .
#Text=That ’s another reason why you have to have a real border .

#Text=The other aspect is that we have the biggest open door in the world , that is the biggest front door , the legal immigration system is very liberal in this country and very open , so it is only appropriate that when people want to come into this country , they knock on the front door .
#Text=Concentrating the political power in Congressional redistricting
#Text=You were originally elected as part of the Reagan Revolution and you came from a historically competitive district —
#Text=Actually a non-competitive district ; it was 2 to 1 Democrat .
#Text=It was so noncompetitive that my opponent announced two weeks before the election that it was so Democrat that Abraham Lincoln could n’t beat him ! [ Laughs ]
#Text=But you won !
#Text=So it sounds competitive .
#Text=Well , it was n’t competitive until 1980 .
#Text=Districts nationwide have become solidly leaning toward one party or another .
#Text=Do you think that since our districts are being drawn in ways — and both parties do this — in ways that ensure one party wins , do you think that hurts our democracy ?
#Text=Well , actually , it ’s always happened since the original Gerrymander by Governor Elbridge Gerry of Massachusetts , which they named the Gerry Salamander and then the Gerrymander .
#Text=The district I ran in had been gerrymandered by the Democrats of the legislature to be heavily Democrat ; I was just able to win it .
#Text=You have the same thing now .
#Text=You have very polarized seats , but it ’s not much different than it was in 1980 .
#Text=In fact , it ’s no difficult at all .

#Text=But studies have shown that districts have become more concentrated , that the votes have become more lopsided toward one party , whereas it used to be more that you would find percentages of 47/53 , whereas now it is 60/40 or 65/35 .
#Text=You consistently win more than 60-70 % of the vote in your district .
#Text=Yeah , well , that ’s true , but that ’s what the old guy used to get in my district in 1980 .
#Text=But then they changed it .
#Text=Yeah , but my point is that the district was actually moved — the Democrat legislature actually cut my house out and moved it around and moved it into East County with a narrow connector .
#Text=SO I have always been subject to the Democrat party controlling redistricting in California .
#Text=They have done what is most expeditious for the party .
